[GRAMMAR]: Incorrect verb tense consistency ("is sent" instead of "was sent").
Subject-verb agreement error ("they was" instead of "they were").
Incorrect verb form ("do not disguised" instead of "do not disguise").

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition between Chapter I (pilgrimage context) and Chapter II (ancient history) without explicit bridging.
[CLARITY]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., long historical descriptions lacking transitional phrases).

[SYNTAX]: Complex sentence structures (e.g., multiple nested clauses) occasionally impede smooth reading.
[LEXICON]: Less common or slightly awkward word choices (e.g., "sultry atmosphere").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from Augustine’s conversion efforts to speculative remarks about the Church of England’s future.
[STRUCTURE]: Tangential discussion about monasticism and the Papal Church disrupts the historical narrative flow.
